description: Decodes an XML document to an ActionScript object graph based on XML Schema definitions.

members.description: When makeObjectsBindable is set to true, anonymous Objects and Arrays are wrapped to make them bindable. Objects are wrapped with mx.utils.ObjectProxy and Arrays are wrapped with mx.collections.ArrayCollection.

When recordXSIType is set to true, if an encoded complexType has an xsi:type attribute the type information will be recorded on the decoded instance if it is strongly typed and implements mx.rpc.xml.IXMLSchemaInstance or is an anonymous mx.utils.ObjectProxy. This type information can be used to post process the decoded objects and identify which concrete implementation of a potentially abstract type was used. The default is false.
Maps XML Schema types by QName to ActionScript Classes in order to create strongly typed objects when decoding content.

Decodes an XML document to an ActionScript object. This may be an XML instance, an XMLList of length 1 or a String that is valid XML. describes how to decode the value, or the name to be used for the decoded value when a type parameter is also specified. complexType definition that describes how to decode the value. schema to describe how to decode this value, a custom element definition can be provided.

values: xml The XML instance to decode to an ActionScript object.
name The QName of an XML Schema element that
type The QName of an XML Schema simpleType or
definition If neither a top-level element nor type exists in the
Returns an ActionScript object decoded from the given XML document.

members.description: Resets the decoder to its initial state, including resetting any Schema scope to the top level and releases the current XML document by setting it to null.
